title: Seeking Evidence Supporting Finding of Fact that the Attack on the USS Liberty was "Mistaken Identity"

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the ship was attacked by the IDF on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.

The Report of the US Navy Court of Inquiry convened to look into all aspects of the June 8, 1967 attack on our ship contains a Finding of Fact claiming “Available evidence combines to indicate the attack on LIBERTY on 8 June was in fact a case of mistaken identity.”

We are requesting to be provided with all the “available evidence” included in the US Navy Court of Inquiry Report (a requirement per the Manual of the Judge Advcate General) that supports that Finding of Fact.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Martin S. Ackerman (1932 – August 1, 1993) was a lawyer and businessman known for mergers and acquisitions. He was the owner of Perfect Film and CHemicals as well as Marvel Comics.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JL Mast

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Hugo Gernsback
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hugo Gernsback, born Hugo Gernsbacher (August 16, 1884 – August 19, 1967), magazine tycoon, inventor.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JL Mast

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Paul Sampliner of Independent News
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Of Paul H Sampliner,  born May 16, 1898 in Cleveland, died in 1975.
He was founder of Independent News (distributor of magazines and comics), founder of the Anti‐Defamation League of B'nai Frith, silent partner at National Comics (also known as DC Comics)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JL Mast

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Martin Goodman
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents mentioning the following publisher, owner of Magazine Mangement, Timely Comics, Atlas Comics, marvel Comics: Martin Goodman (born January 18, 1908 in brooklyn under the name Moe Goodman – died June 6, 1992)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JL Mast
